author: Merrilees Parker
method: Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Place the flour and sugar in a large bowl and mix well. Taking a few cubes of butter at a time rub into the flour mixture. Keep rubbing until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs.  Place the fruit in a large bowl and sprinkle over the sugar, flour and cinnamon. Stir well being careful not to break up the fruit.  Butter a 24cm/9in ovenproof dish. Spoon the fruit mixture into the bottom, then sprinkle the crumble mixture on top.  Bake in the oven for 40-45 minutes until the crumble is browned and the fruit mixture bubbling.  Serve with thick cream or custard.
ingredients: 300g/10½oz plain flour, sieved pinch of salt ,  175g/6oz unrefined brown sugar ,  200g/7oz unsalted butter, cubed at room temperature ,  Knob of butter for greasing ,  450g/1lb apples, peeled, cored and cut into 1cm/½in pieces ,  50g/2oz unrefined brown sugar ,  1 tbsp plain flour ,  1 pinch of ground cinnamon
